claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination broadened tumor antigen presentation, including peptides displayed through MHC-I.

evidence.quote: | Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination |
| Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape |

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Type I interferon signaling is a key mechanistic requirement for the observed sensitization to checkpoint blockade.

evidence.quote: - Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
1. Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors, limiting certainty about human mechanistic dependence.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination increased checkpoint relevance and immune infiltration, supporting combination with anti-PD-L1 therapy.

evidence.quote: | PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue | 2.4x | 1.0x | Checkpoint axis became more targetable |
| Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change | 1.8x | 1.0x | Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy |
4. PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

claims.caveat: Vaccine-only and ICI-only controls showed limited standalone benefit in low-immunogenic settings, so benefit depends on context.

claims.claim: In the retrospective metastatic cohort, prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination was associated with better survival during ICI treatment.

evidence.quote: | Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment |
- Translational arm: a retrospective cohort of metastatic patients receiving ICI treatment, compared by prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination status.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized, with variable vaccination timing and heterogeneous tumor/treatment backgrounds.
